content zone
Friends of Boyd Hill Nature Preserve
1101 Country Club Way S.
St. Petersburg, FL 33705
Executive Director, Jason Cowen: jason@friendsofboydhill.org
The Friends of Boyd Hill does not manage the volunteer or program requests for Boyd Hill Nature Preserve, the City of St. Petersburg manages all requests for programming. If you're interested in becoming a volunteer or want to request programming, please follow the instructions below:
Within the
volunteer application
, you will find the application process and the descriptions for the volunteer areas. Please note that the Bird of Prey program is not currently accepting new volunteers and recruits from the active volunteer base. If you have any questions after reading through the application process or descriptions, please email
BHPreserve@stpete.org
.
Within the
program request form
, you will find the descriptions for the available programs and event opportunities. Please note, this form is just a request. Preserve staff will reply to your request with confirmation or for any needed changes due to unavailability. If you have any questions after reading through the program request or descriptions, please email
BHPreserve@stpete.org
.
/content zone

content zone
The City of St. Petersburg owns, operates and manages Boyd Hill Nature Preserve. The 245-acre, award-winning property features 6 miles of trails and boardwalks through a variety of habitats including hardwood hammocks, sand pine scrub, pine flatwoods, willow marsh, swamp woodlands and lake shore. The Preserve, formerly known as Lake Maggiore Park, was renamed in 1958 after a park superintendent whose dream was to bring together the people of an urban community and nature-in-the-raw without disturbing the balance of either.
Annual trail passes are available for purchase (in person only, at the Lake Maggiore Environmental Education Center).
Information on upcoming classes and programs is available
here.
Information on children's day camps is available
here.
Lake Maggiore Environmental Education Center
Admission: $3 Adult
$1.50 Child (Age 3 to 16)
Free (Age 2 and under)
Sorry, no pets.
Hours: November 1 - February 29
Tuesday - Friday 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
Saturday 7:00 am – 6:00 pm
Sunday 9:00 am - 6:00 pm •
Monday Closed
Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day
Hours: March 1 - October 31
Tuesday - Friday 9:00 am - 7:00 pm
Saturday 7:00 am – 7:00 pm
Sunday 9:00 am - 7:00 pm •
Monday Closed
The
City of St. Petersburg coordinates a variety of volunteer opportunities
at the Preserve, including animal care, land management, gardening, and more. Please fill out an
application
and contact the Volunteer Coordinator at 727-893-7326 to sign up for an orientation.
